    \label{trunk:qstkutil:tsutil:fillforward}
    \index{trunk \textit{(package)}!trunk.qstkutil \textit{(package)}!trunk.qstkutil.tsutil \textit{(module)}!trunk.qstkutil.tsutil.fillforward \textit{(function)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{fillforward}(\textit{nd})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    @summary Removes NaNs from a 2D array by scanning forward in the 1st 
    dimension.  If a cell is NaN, the value above it is carried forward.

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
      \textbf{Parameters}
      \vspace{-1ex}

      \begin{quote}
        \begin{Ventry}{xx}

          \item[nd]

          the array to fill forward @return the array is revised in place

        \end{Ventry}

      \end{quote}

    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{trunk:qstkutil:tsutil:fillbackward}
    \index{trunk \textit{(package)}!trunk.qstkutil \textit{(package)}!trunk.qstkutil.tsutil \textit{(module)}!trunk.qstkutil.tsutil.fillbackward \textit{(function)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{fillbackward}(\textit{nd})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    @summary Removes NaNs from a 2D array by scanning backward in the 1st 
    dimension.  If a cell is NaN, the value above it is carried backward.

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
      \textbf{Parameters}
      \vspace{-1ex}

      \begin{quote}
        \begin{Ventry}{xx}

          \item[nd]

          the array to fill backward @return the array is revised in place

        \end{Ventry}

      \end{quote}

    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{trunk:qstkutil:tsutil:returnize0}
    \index{trunk \textit{(package)}!trunk.qstkutil \textit{(package)}!trunk.qstkutil.tsutil \textit{(module)}!trunk.qstkutil.tsutil.returnize0 \textit{(function)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{returnize0}(\textit{nd})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    @summary Computes stepwise (usually daily) returns relative to 0, where
    0 implies no change in value. @return the array is revised in place

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{trunk:qstkutil:tsutil:returnize1}
    \index{trunk \textit{(package)}!trunk.qstkutil \textit{(package)}!trunk.qstkutil.tsutil \textit{(module)}!trunk.qstkutil.tsutil.returnize1 \textit{(function)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{returnize1}(\textit{nd})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    @summary Computes stepwise (usually daily) returns relative to 1, where
    1 implies no change in value.

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
      \textbf{Parameters}
      \vspace{-1ex}

      \begin{quote}
        \begin{Ventry}{xx}

          \item[nd]

          the array to fill backward @return the array is revised in place

        \end{Ventry}

      \end{quote}
